summary: An ordinance relating to and providing for the improvement of 15th Avenue West, Thorndyke Avenue and 13th Avenue West, in the City of Seattle from Grandview Boulevard to the south end of the bridge crossing Salmon Bay by planking a roadway 14 feet in width; all in accordance with Resolution No. 198 and providing the payment therefor by the mode of 'Payment by Bond' as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
